t: To the Chief Musician. Set to “Do Not Destroy.” A Michtam of David when he fled from Saul into the cave.
Be*pn merciful to me, O God, be merciful to me! For*ld my soul trusts in You; And*ld in the shadow of Your wings I will make my refuge, Until*ld these*i calamities have passed by.
I*ln will cry out to God Most High, To*ld God who performs all*i things*i for me.
He*ld shall send from heaven and save me; He*ld reproaches the one who would swallow me up. Selah*ipg God*ld shall send forth His mercy and His truth.
My*ln soul is*i among lions; I*ld lie among*i the sons of men Who*ld are set on fire, Whose*ld teeth are*i spears and arrows, And*ld their tongue a sharp sword.
Be*ld exalted, O God, above the heavens; Let*ild Your glory be*i above all the earth.
They*ln have prepared a net for my steps; My*ld soul is bowed down; They*ld have dug a pit before me; Into*ld the midst of it they themselves*i have fallen. Selah*ipg
My*pn heart is steadfast, O God, my heart is steadfast; I*ld will sing and give praise.
Awake,*ld my glory! Awake,*ld lute and harp! I*ld will awaken the dawn.
I*ln will praise You, O Lord, among the peoples; I*ld will sing to You among the nations.
For*ld Your mercy reaches unto the heavens, And*ld Your truth unto the clouds.
Be*ln exalted, O God, above the heavens; Let*ild Your glory be*i above all the earth.
